newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber end up on pre-holiday short covering.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber end up on pre-holiday short covering.

text.p: CME lumber futures drifted higher on scattered short covering ahead of the long holiday weekend, traders said.
Lumber closed mostly $4.50 to $2.90 per tbf higher with July up most at $376.50 and September up $3.40 at $370.60.

Selling interest following another decline in cash lumber prices lacked followthrough and prices drifted up on the short covering. Higher bond futures, pointing to lower interest rates, and the higher stock market also provided underlying support. But trading action was very slow right into the close, they said.
Random Lengths quoted cash spruce at $362 per tbf, off $2 from midweek and $10 under last Friday's level.
Production continued to outweigh demand, traders added.
